marketNews.title: Realization of APBN 8M25: Tax Revenue Still Weak, Expenditure Accelerating
marketNews.content:
The Ministry of Finance on Monday (22/9) presented the realization of the State Budget (APBN) up to August 2025. Key points are as follows:

State Revenue Still Contracting, Below Seasonal Trend
State revenue for the first eight months of 2025 (8M25) reached IDR 1,638.7 trillion (-7.8% YoY), equivalent to about 57% of the 2025 APBN outlook (versus 8M24: about 63% of the 2024 APBN realization). Tax revenue – the main contributor to state revenue – still declined by -5.1% YoY during 8M25. The Ministry of Finance attributes the decline in tax revenue to restitution factors, noting that gross tax revenue still increased by +2.1% YoY during 8M25.

State Expenditure Accelerated, Relatively Aligned with Seasonal Trend
State expenditure for 8M25 reached IDR 1,960.3 trillion (+1.5% YoY), equivalent to about 56% of the 2025 APBN outlook (versus 8M24: about 58% of the 2024 APBN realization). Both central government spending (+1.5% YoY) and transfers to regions (+1.7% YoY) recorded positive growth. The expenditure trend also shows acceleration compared with previous months. For comparison, state expenditure in the first half of 2025 (1H25) grew only +0.6% YoY, while the realization for the first five months of 2025 (5M25) was still down -11% YoY.

The Ministry also reported that as of 8 September 2025, the implementation of the Free Nutritious Meal program had reached 22.71 million beneficiaries with a budget realization of about IDR 13 trillion, only 18.3% of the program's budget ceiling of IDR 71 trillion. Previously, Finance Minister Purbaya said that the ministry would continue to monitor the budget realization of government programs and reallocate funds if implementation is slow.

The APBN 2025 realization for 8M25 resulted in a deficit of IDR 321.6 trillion, equivalent to 1.35% of GDP (versus 8M24: 0.69% of GDP).

Key Takeaway
We assess that the acceleration of government spending until the end of 2025 is needed to revive economic growth in the second half of 2025. In addition to overall spending acceleration, the government has launched several initiatives such as liquidity injection and an additional stimulus package for the economy.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
- The House of Representatives on Tuesday (23/9) passed the 2026 State Budget Law with a deficit target of 2.68% of GDP and an economic growth target of +5.4% YoY. The 2026 APBN also targets inflation at 2.5% YoY, the rupiah exchange rate at 16,500 per US dollar, a 10-year SBN yield at 6.9%, Indonesian Crude Price at US$70 per barrel, oil lifting at 610,000 barrels per day, and gas lifting at 984,000 barrels of oil equivalent per day.
- Indonesia and the European Union on Tuesday (23/9) signed a comprehensive economic partnership agreement (IEU-CEPA) in Bali. The agreement will eliminate tariffs for 80% of Indonesian export products to the EU, including key commodities such as palm oil, fisheries, and textiles. Conversely, Indonesia will eliminate import duties on 98.5% of goods from the EU and simplify entry procedures for EU products, including cars and food items. Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto expects the agreement to take effect on 1 January 2027. The government expects EU-bound exports to double within the first five years of implementation.
- Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto said on Monday (22/9) that the government will extend the 100% government-covered value-added tax (PPN DTP) incentive for the housing sector until 2026. Under this scheme, the government will fully bear VAT on the purchase of newly built ready-to-move houses with a maximum selling price of IDR 2 billion. For properties priced around IDR 2-5 billion, the VAT exemption applies only to the first IDR 2 billion. Kontan reported that the government has prepared a PPN DTP incentive ceiling of IDR 3.4 trillion for 2026, targeting 40,000 new housing units.
- Bank Indonesia recorded that broad money (M2) in August 2025 grew +7.6% YoY to IDR 9,657.1 trillion (vs. July 2025: +6.6% YoY). The growth was driven by narrow money (M1) expanding +10.5% YoY and quasi-money increasing +5.6% YoY.
- The House of Representatives on Tuesday (23/9) approved Anggito Abimanyu as the chair of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS) Board for the 2025-2030 period, replacing Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa, who was appointed as finance minister. Anggito is currently deputy finance minister. Kontan reported that Anggito's name was not in the selection list of the LPS committee in July 2025, but later appeared in a letter sent by President Prabowo Subianto to the House. Finance Minister Purbaya confirmed that Anggito will resign as deputy finance minister after being officially appointed as LPS chair.
- The President Director of Wijaya Karya (WIKA), Agung Budi Waskito, said that the company recorded new contract values of IDR 5.24 trillion during 8M25 (-61% YoY). The new contracts were dominated by the construction support industry sector at 49.8%, followed by infrastructure and building at 33.8%.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Acquires 0.46% of SCMA Shares Worth Rp105 Billion
tickerNews.content: $SCMA: Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK) bought approximately 342.4 million SCMA shares at an average price of about IDR 307 per share between 20 August and 22 September 2025. The total transaction value was about IDR 105 billion. After this transaction, EMTK’s ownership in SCMA increased from 66.43% to 66.89%.

tickerNews.title: TINS Director Targets 30,000 Ton Tin Ore Production in 2026
tickerNews.content: $TINS: President Director of Timah, Restu Widiyantoro, said the company targets tin ore production of 30,000 tons of Sn in 2026, a 39.5% increase from the 2025 work plan and budget (RKAP) level of 21,500 tons of Sn. TINS remains optimistic about achieving the 2025 tin ore production target, although 1H25 production reached only 6,997 tons of Sn (-32% YoY) and refined tin production was 6,870 metric tons (-29% YoY). Restu explained that the formation of a task force to combat illegal tin mining will help the company reach its target.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Announces Share Buyback of Approximately 103.7 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $SIDO: Sido Muncul announced a buyback plan of about 103.7 million shares (0.35% of total) during the period 23 September – 22 December 2025. The estimated funding for this buyback is IDR 56 billion, which comes from the remaining allocation of previous buyback programs announced in March and June 2025. SIDO also maintains a buyback price ceiling of IDR 760 per share.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Plans to Add Over 100 Aircraft by 2029
tickerNews.content: $GIAA: Garuda Indonesia Director Reza Aulia Hakim said the airline plans to add more than 100 aircraft by 2029, which would enable the company to operate over 100 routes and capture a 50% domestic market share. Business reported that GIAA’s fleet reached 78 aircraft as of August 2025 and the company will add 2 aircraft by the end of 2025. Reza also mentioned that GIAA President Director Wamildan Tsani will travel to the United States this week to discuss aircraft procurement with Boeing, as part of the Indonesia-US trade agreement.

tickerNews.title: APLN Reports 1.02 Trillion Rupiah Marketing Sales in 8M25
tickerNews.content: $APLN: Agung Podomoro Land Company Secretary Justini Omas told Kontan that the company recorded marketing sales of IDR 1.02 trillion during 8M25, reaching 60% of the 2025 target of IDR 1.7 trillion. Looking ahead to the second half of 2025, Justini said APLN will focus more on landed house development, as this segment has high absorption potential aligned with consumer preferences.
